title: High Ping and Packet Loss
body:
Hello, 
So I have recently been having issues with high ping and packet loss with the game. I am with Bell Canada and I brought up the issue with them and they sent me a replacement modem because they believed that was what was causing all my issues... Turns out it isn't.
I have come to the conclusion that it must be something else so i'm here seeking help. I have done everything on my end to try and fix this issue but i'm out of ideas at this point.

My current experience in games is my ping stays at a steady 35 then spikes to 50 then up to 100-600 then drops down to 35 and rinse and repeat for the rest of the game. It has made my hobby impossible to do and I need some help!!

Ty, Dr My Mundo

replies.body:
These sorts of issues are most often caused by an issue along your network routing to the servers. Since you've already had your modem replaced, that's probably not a factor here. Before we take a look at your network routing, I'd like you to work through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure all your local settings are properly configured for League.

Let me know if this caused any changes for you.

Nothing has changed for me. If anything it's gotten worse... 
200-300 ping consistently and if i'm lucky my ping will drop to 30 for 1 second.

Since you're still encountering issues, we'll need to run a traceroute with [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) in order to determine where this issue is coming from. After loading up the application, simply plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field before starting the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you run into any issues.
I'm having the exact same issue, the last 2 days I have been constant ping spikes for no reason
